intro: Merremia verdcourtiana, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or near water sources. Due to its rapid growth and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
